item.title: Well-posed Self-Similarity in Incompressible Standard Flows
item.description: arXiv:2504.21000v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This article reviews the properties of the self-similar solutions of the Navier-Stokes equation for incompressible fluids. Since any smooth solution can be embedded into a self-similar solution at the identity scale, it follows that under standard flow conditions, the initial solution will remain smooth for all time as long as the self-similar solution is selected to have certain isobaric weight.
item.dc:creator: J. Polihronov
